item.title: Economy: Brazil reforms to spur competitiveness, productivity and trade would strengthen COVID-19 recovery
item.description: The COVID-19 outbreak has brought Brazil’s economy back into recession, with swift government support helping millions of vulnerable households. A strong and inclusive recovery from the crisis that benefits all Brazilians will require additional ambitious reforms, the latest OECD Economic Survey of Brazil says.

item.title: Opinion: A multilateral agenda for a strong, resilient, green and inclusive recovery from COVID-19
item.description: Only through collective action will we be able to 'build back better' towards more resilient, more inclusive and greener economies and societies. A strong ambition as we celebrate the OECD’s 60th anniversary: By President of the Spanish Government Pedro Sánchez and OECD Secretary-General Angel Gurría

item.title: Climate change: The Paris Agreement five years on–Taking stock and looking forward
item.description: Saturday 12 December marks the 5th anniversary of the Paris Agreement, a comprehensive global plan to tackle climate change. In a special statement, OECD Secretary-General Angel Gurría points to the real opportunities in 2021 for driving progress on climate action and towards a sustainable recovery from the COVID-19 crisis.

item.title: Tax evasion: International community reaches important milestone in fight against tax evasion
item.description: New international standards on the automatic exchange of financial account information for tax purposes have been deemed as satisfactorily implemented by countries worldwide. Some 88% of jurisdictions engaged in the exchange process have satisfactory legal frameworks in place, a milestone in the fight against tax evasion, a new report says.

item.title: Health: Asia-Pacific countries have managed COVID-19 crisis relatively well but major challenges remain
item.description: Australia, Japan, Korea and New Zealand have done relatively well in addressing the COVID-19 epidemic and limiting the first wave of the virus, according to Health at a Glance Asia/Pacific 2020. The report is the OECD’s first analysis of the pandemic's impact on health systems and the policy responses in the Asia-Pacific region.
